items.title: Ruben Amorim sacked by Manchester United and Darren Fletcher takes interim role ‚Äì live
items.summary: Amorim sacked after losing power struggle over transfers Darren Fletcher to take charge for game at Burnley Have any thoughts? Send them to Dom via email 1. Ole Gunnar Solskjaer (2018-2021) ‚Äì 54% win rate The Norwegian started off as a caretaker and his impact was so great that United granted him the full-time job. Undoubtedly the best football of the post-Ferguson era was played under Solskjaer, who preferred his side to counter-attack at speed and enjoyed a sensational record against Manchester City and Pep Guardiola, beating them three times at the Etihad. Came second in the league in 2020-201 but was denied an elusive trophy by the agonising 2021 Europa League final defeat to Villarreal on penalties. Continue reading...

items.title: NAC-aanvoerder Kemper bedankt voor Grieks avontuur

items.title: Newcastle ask Meta to help police find individual who sent racist abuse to Willock
items.summary: Midfielder was target of abuse and threats on Instagram Club call for ‚Äòmeaningful action from Meta‚Äô Newcastle have urged Meta, the owner of Instagram, to assist Northumbria police in identifying the individual responsible for subjecting the midfielder Joe Willock to racist abuse and threats of violence on the social media platform. Willock, a Newcastle substitute during Sunday‚Äôs 2-0 Premier League home win against Crystal Palace, missed a late chance to extend his team‚Äôs lead and, shortly afterwards, received a series of racist messages from an anonymous Instagram account. items.title: Wilfried Nancy sacked by Celtic after eight matches and 33 days in charge
items.summary: Frenchman leaves club after dismal spell in charge Celtic six points behind Hearts at top of Premiership Wilfried Nancy has been sacked by Celtic after eight matches ‚Äì and 33 days ‚Äì in charge, in the wake of Saturday‚Äôs 3-1 home defeat by Rangers. Nancy lost six of his eight games and losing the Old Firm game from 1-0 up at half-time proved the final straw after a dismal spell. The 48-year-old leaves with Celtic six points behind Hearts in the Scottish Premiership, and having lost the League Cup final to St Mirren. Continue reading...
